goals.question: What is the distribution of departure delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of departure delays and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between arrival and departure delays?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of arrival delays vs departure delays
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between arrival and departure delays.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of flight distances and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of cancelled flights?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of cancelled flights by airline
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which airlines have the highest number of cancelled flights.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?
goals.visualization: Box plot of flight delays by airline
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of flight delays by airline and identify any outliers.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', bins=30, kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['departure_delay'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f"Median: {data['departure_delay'].median():.2f}")
    plt.title('What is the distribution of departure delays?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='departure_delay', y='arrival_delay')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between arrival and departure delays?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Departure Delay')
    plt.ylabel('Arrival Delay')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='distance', bins=30, kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['distance'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2)
    plt.legend(['Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['distance'].median())])
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight distances?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Flight Distances')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="whitegrid")
    ax = sns.barplot(x="airline", y="cancelled", data=data, palette="muted")
    ax.set_title("What is the distribution of cancelled flights?", wrap=True)
    ax.set_xlabel("Airline")
    ax.set_ylabel("Cancelled Flights")
    plt.legend(title="Airline", loc="upper right")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.boxplot(x='airline', y='flight_delay', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Airline')
    plt.ylabel('Flight Delay')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(title='Airline', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
